title.value: Neural Graph Generation from Graph Statistics
title.justification: This is the title of the research paper.
title.quote: Neural Graph Generation from Graph Statistics

extractions.description: This paper introduces GenStat, a deep Graph Generative Model (GGM) that learns from aggregate graph statistics rather than a complete adjacency matrix, aiming to preserve local differential privacy while generating realistic graphs.

type.justification: The paper is centered around the development and evaluation of the GenStat model through empirical validation on multiple datasets.
type.quote: Empirical evaluation on 8 datasets indicates that our deep GGM generates more realistic graphs than the traditional non-neural GGMs when both are learned from graph statistics only.

name.justification: The paper focuses on developing and evaluating a model to generate graphs based on graph statistics.
name.quote: We describe a new setting for learning a deep graph generative model (GGM) from aggregate graph statistics, rather than from the graph adjacency matrix... We introduce GenStat, a novel deep graph generative architecture that requires access only to graph-level statistics.

name.justification: A significant focus of the paper is on the privacy-preserving nature of the proposed GenStat model.
name.quote: Our main motivation for generating graphs from statistics is privacy preservation... GenStat also satisfies local differential privacy, while generating high-quality graphs.

name.justification: The GenStat model is introduced and evaluated extensively throughout the paper.
name.quote: This paper presents GenStat, a new deep GGM architecture for a setting where the available graph data are summarized by graph statistics... Our GenStat system is a neural alternative that generates substantially more realistic graphs.

is_contributed.justification: The model GenStat is an original contribution introduced in this paper.
is_contributed.quote: We introduce GenStat, a novel deep graph generative architecture that requires access only to graph-level statistics.

is_executed.justification: The paper details the implementation and datasets used indicating that the model was executed.
is_executed.quote: The implementation and datasets are provided at GenStat repository https://github.com/kiarashza/GenStat.git and explained in the Appendix Section 7.9.

is_compared.justification: The paper compares the performance of GenStat against other models.
is_compared.quote: Compared to parametric statistics-based methods, GenStat generates graphs that are up to 10 times more realistic on Maximum Mean Discrepancy (MMD) metrics.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper title is the current paper itself.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We introduce GenStat, a novel deep graph generative architecture that requires access only to graph-level statistics.
